Articles.Content:
Hi!

I installed KSP 1.2 on the Windows partition of my computer. I haven't tried it before on windows (I used it on the MacOS partition and it worked). I use a MacBook Pro with 16GB DDR3.

The problem is that the RAM becomes full while the game is running and then the program crashes. I checked the resources and it seems that after loading KSP the RAM holds about 6GB of data (I have some mods). When I start a scenario, the amount of data in RAM starts to increase at a rate of about 250-300 MB per second. When the RAM is full, data is placed in the virtual memory. When the count reaches 32 GB (16GB RAM + 16GB virtual memory) the game crashes with an access violation error.

I tried to reduce texture complexity and the graphic settings in general, but the crash happens anyway... it's just a matter of time after loading a scenario.

I will try to remove all the mods to see if that is the cause of the problem anyway.

Ok, as expected it looks like a mod problem. I will try to add a mod at a time to see what is causing the problem and then I'll contact the mod publisher.

Thanks!

It seems that the problem was caused by Scatterer.

After reading through the log I found that there was a missing file in one of the folder. After restoring the missing file, KSP works fine.
